video_description: Mobile Syrup takes a look at the Canadian version of Sony's Tablet S Honeycomb tablet. The tablet runs Android 3.1 and has a 1Ghz dual-core Tegra 2 processor, 1GB RAM, 16 or 32GB internal storage, 5MP back camera and VGA front camera, and a beautiful 9.4" 1280x800 pixel screen.
title: Sony Tablet S Review

comments.text:
We're hardwired to like symmetry. A face with a bigger ear on one side is well...not as pretty as a symmetrical one. Have you seen the Nokia 5220? Asymmetric, therefore ugly
---
(IMO) All I'm saying is, even though Sony makes fantastic hardware (hence why I own a ton of their stuff), they oughta take a page out of Apple's book. Build hardware around a good design, and not the other way around. Point in fact, the﻿ Nokia N9 and 800 Lumia. Beautiful phones built from the outside --> in.
comments.author: Vihir Patel

comments.text:
@4256Conroy 

Galaxy Tab : thinner, lighter (premium-ish plastic finish), bigger screen, more expensive, no card slot, 3MP rear only camera, longer lasting battery @ 7000mAh
---
Tablet S : thicker, smaller screen (but same resolution so higher ppi), premium finish, has a smoother feel (animations), cheaper, 5MP rear & 0.3MP﻿ front cameras, SD card slot available & 5000mAh battery
---
Both use Nvidia Tegra 2 @ 1GHz. So overall, it comes down to price, looks & which features you will use the most.
